Methods.Name: ext.events
Methods.Description: This is the way to intialize the events code for an object. First you must extend the object or (dog) in this way. Passing in the names / array of the events is optional but helpful in explaining the current events being expected. Named events are really arrays of functions that get called by triggerEvent. In this way different parts of your code can subscribe to the events of other parts without having to call the methods directly.

Definitions.dog: An Object, Module, or part of Module
Definitions.Name: The name of the event
Definitions.Events: Array of Functions to run when the named event is triggered

Methods.Name: addEvent
Methods.Description: Adds an event to the system

Definitions.Name: The name of the event
Definitions.Func: Function to run when the event is triggered

Definitions.Name: The name of the event
Definitions.Args: List of arguments that get passed to the function triggered by event

Methods.Name: emptyEvent
Methods.Description: Adds an event to the system
